title: Adding file to git in direct mode fails
body:
I ran into trouble when trying to add a file to git instead of annex in direct mode.
But in https://github.com/datalad/testrepo--basic--r1.git we have this situation and things are as expected in direct mode, if I clone this one. Therefore this situation should be achievable from within direct mode too.

Here is how to reproduce it:

```
ben@tree:~/Development$ mkdir testannex
ben@tree:~/Development$ cd testannex
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git init
Initialized empty Git repository in /home/ben/Development/testannex/.git/
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex init
init  ok
(recording state in git...)
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ touch testfile
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex direct
commit
On branch master
Initial commit
Untracked files:
    testfile
nothing added to commit but untracked files present
ok
direct  ok
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex proxy -- git add testfile
error: pathspec '.' did not match any file(s) known to git.
git-annex: Failed to set up proxy work tree.
```

Why is it '.'?
May be we need something in annex first, so add this file to annex and then try again:

```
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex add testfile
add testfile ok
(recording state in git...)
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex proxy -- git status
On branch annex/direct/master
Initial commit
Changes to be committed:
  (use "git rm --cached <file>..." to unstage)
    new file:   testfile
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex proxy -- git commit -m firstcommit
ok
[annex/direct/master (root-commit) 9cb4be8] firstcommit
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)
 create mode 120000 testfile
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ touch testfile2
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex proxy -- git add testfile2
fatal: pathspec 'testfile2' did not match any files
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex proxy -- git status
On branch annex/direct/master
nothing to commit, working directory clean
```

Additionally, when using absolute path the result surprisingly states, this was outside repository:

```
ben@tree:~/Development/testannex$ git annex proxy -- git add /home/ben/Development/testannex/testfile2
fatal: /home/ben/Development/testannex/testfile2: '/home/ben/Development/testannex/testfile2' is outside repository
```

So far, I don't see what's wrong here.
